item.title: Christine add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I guess there are never enough books." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Christine add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Anything that just costs money is cheap." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Christine add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Christine add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "To be alive──is Power." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Christine add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Intention, good or bad, is not enough." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Christine add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "My friends are my estate." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Christine add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Ginger: You know what the greatest tragedy is in the whole world?... It's all the people who never find out what it is they really want to do or what it is they're really good at. It's all the sons who become blacksmiths because their fathers were blacksmiths. It's all the people who could be really fantastic flute players who grow old and die without ever seeing a musical instrument, so they become bad plowmen instead. It's all the people with talents who never even find out. Maybe they are never even <i>born</i> in a time when it's even possible to find out. It's all the people who never get to know what it is that they can really be. <i>It's all the wasted chances</i>." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Christine add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Christine add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "You can only understand people if you feel them in yourself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Christine add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Christine add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Christine add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Christine add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "My idea of good company...is the company of clever, well-informed people, who have a great deal of conversation; that is what I call good company.' 'You are mistaken,' said he gently, 'that is not good company, that is the best." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Christine add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Only in our dreams are we free. The rest of the time we need wages." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Christine add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good plan isn't one where someone wins, it's where nobody thinks they've lost." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Christine add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "My name is immaterial,' she said. That's a pretty name,' said Rincewind." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Christine add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I am excessively diverted. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Christine add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "When in doubt, choose to live." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Christine add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Christine add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Some people turn sad awfully young. No special reason, it seems, but they seem almost to be born that way. They bruise easier, tire faster, cry quicker, remember longer and, as I say, get sadder younger than anyone else in the world. I know, for I'm one of them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "What a terrible mistake to let go of something wonderful for something real." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "Do you have doubts about life? Are you unsure if it's worth the trouble? Look at the sky: that is for you. Look at each person's face as you pass on the street: those faces are for you. And the street itself, and the ground under the street and the ball of fire underneath the ground: all these things are for you. They are as much for you as they are for other people. Remember this when you wake up in the morning and think you have nothing. Stand up and face the east. Now praise the sky and praise the light within each person under the sky. It's okay to be unsure. But praise, praise, praise." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "Are you angry? Punch a pillow. Was it satisfying? Not hardly. These days people are too angry for punching. What you might try is stabbing. Take an old pillow and lay it on the front lawn. Stab it with a big pointy knife. Again and again and again. Stab hard enough for the point of the knife to go into the ground. Stab until the pillow is gone and you are just stabbing the earth again and again, as if you want to kill it for continuing to spin, as if you are getting revenge for having to live on this planet day after day, alone." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "I cried in English, I cried in french, I cried in all the languages, because tears are the same all around the world." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "I walked down the hall and saw that [she] was sitting on the floor next to a chair. This is always a bad sign. It's a slippery slope, and it's best just to sit in chairs, to eat when hungry, to sleep and rise and work. But we have all been there. Chairs are for people, and you're not sure if you are one." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "It is terrible to have to ask for anything ever. We wish we were something that needed nothing, like paint. But even paint needs repainting." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "i wondered if i would spend the rest of my life inventing complicated ways to depress myself.." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "She never inquired, but she never recoiled, either. This is a quality that I look for in a person, not recoiling." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "I made orange juice from concentrate and showed her the trick of squeezing the juice of one real orange into it. It removes the taste of being frozen. She marveled at this, and I laughed and said, Life is easy. What I meant was, Life is easy with you here, and when you leave, it will be hard again." -- Miranda July

item.title: Christine add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett
